Buenos días.

No puedo crear una nueva tarea. El botón "+ Nueva Tarea" aparece visible per no disponible. Gracias.

creator: davidparrish4570

title: Gmail IMAP Folder Changed in Supernova
content: Hello. Latest update Supernova (now using 115.5.0 but this happened a few weeks ago) has eliminated the yellow Gmail IMAP folder and now those folders are listed in Folder pane on the same level with TB folders and icons. The result is confusing as to which are TB and which are Gmail. Two Drafts folders, a Bin and a Trash folder, a Junk and a Spam folder as well as a Sent and Sent Mail folder. In previous versions, Gmail was a yellow folder that, when expanded, listed all Gmail IMAP subfolders. Now it's hard to tell what's what. Any suggestions as to revive the previous - and much clearer - layout where Gmail was its own yellow folder and IMAP Inbox, Sent Mail, etc. were underneath as subfolders? Thanks in advance to the good guys in here who generously give their time and efforts helping out confused customers such as myself! Your efforts ARE appreciated... Cheers, Ted
creator: teddybearable

title: Every log in downloading thousands of emails?
content: Hello, Thunderbird user daily for years. Lately every time I open Thunderbird it starts downloading a random number of emails, usually in the thousands. this makes the app extremely slow and laggy until it finishes. I use it daily, on avg getting 20-30 emails. I don't understand why its downloading emails form months to years ago.
creator: robbiecampbell65

title: Outgoing (pre-send) mail filters - how?
content:
Hello,

how do I set up an outgoing mail filter in Thunderbird that is applied before the email is actually sent?

I'm using this to automatically add (varying) Cc/Bcc recipients to the email before sending, depending on the mail account used for sending and the recipient's mail address/domain, change the To address based on some condition, or switch to a different From address based e.g. on contents.

As I understand it, TB allows me to apply filters automatically on a mail only after it has already been sent, which for my use cases is too late.

Any ideas? Is there a plugin that does this?

Thanks, Christian
creator: kriro18

title: supernova
content:
supernovA how do I go back to "classic" which works? the new version has problems all over it , I can't move an email to folders as the folders have disappeared in the navigation bar and the pull down only shows about 8 folders ,, , the navigation bars is totally new and not a good UI at all, too much change with a big bang, no support , no way to fix it..it was easy to use - but now no longer , as I can't do anything ,, let alone even play with it and learn.

You should never release software to a user base without stepping them through things first, , you've probably turned a lot of people off.. and could have lost them forever

its frustrating,
creator: stevemort

title: My email attachments I receive are encrypted
content: My emails I receive attachments when I open come encrypted and I can not read. Please help with taking off the encryption. Thanks Tim
creator: thewaterboy

title: Support recurring tasks from Google Calendar
content: Thunderbird allows me to connect my Google Calendar to TB. But it doesn't allow me to add the new Google Tasks calendar. For that, I need to use Google Calendar Provider. Once subscribed to Google Tasks I can create and manage tasks. However, I cannot create, manage, or even see tasks that recur. TB should either support Google Tasks natively or through Google Calendar Provider support recurring tasks.
creator: Andrew5

title: Add link to Google Maps for addresses in events in the calendar
content:
Would it kill ya to add a simple link to Google Maps (or even other map sites), if a calendar event contains an address? I use the Calendar a lot and make sure that I have addresses associated with events. This allows Google and Android Auto to pop up a notification asking me if I'm going to XYZ event. I then tap Navigate and off I go. But sometimes when I'm on my desktop I look at a calendar event and wonder where exactly I'm going to be driving to and I have to open the event and copy and paste the address into a browser set on Google Maps. It'd be way more convenient to just tap a link on the TB event notification or maybe in the right-click menu of the event on the Calendar or alongside of the address in the event details.

Been wondering about this for years and finally got around to submitting the request here.
creator: Andrew5

title: Thunderbird: A missing email account & folders
content:
Back in 2016, via GoDaddy I set up a personal domain. As part of the package, they offered to host two email addresses using that domain. I set up both in Thunderbird.

In June 2022 GoDaddy asked that all such accounts be switched to Microsoft Exchange, which I did with one of the two.

Very recently, perhaps with the recent Thunderbird upgrade, that account--and its sub-folders--have disappeared from Thunderbird. I need to restore them.

Thanks for the help!
creator: j_heyl

title: Thunderbird List of Messages
content: Cannot find how to make my list of messages appear like they do in outlook. There is a screen shot on Thunderbird home page that it appears it can be done. See attached.

title: aatachment allways shown in email
content: attacahments are shwon in the email but not in the status bar. I found the opption "shown in email" in the menu. But it doesn't matter if it is amrked or not!
creator: mail530

title: Support for compressed eml files
content:
I use gmvault to back up several years worth of emails, and it's working very nicely. What I'm missing is an easy way to access those emails, which area stored as a pair of files per email—<id>.eml.gz and <id>.meta in a folder structure organised by date—db/2011-06/ for example for June 2011. The .meta file is JSON with some gmail-related stuff in it (gm_id, threads, flags, internal_date, subject, etc.)

I'd love to have a nice interface and even search capability across all those emails, but it doesn't seem like Thunderbird can support compressed files by default. Is there any setting or add-on which might enable this? I rarely need to access these old emails, but when I do it's painful to have to manually decompress and re-compress them.
creator: dl31

title: Recognize "SV", "AW" and others as alternatives to "Re" in incoming mail.
content:
My Thunderbird is set up to add "Re" to the subject line when replying. When I receive a mail from a Danish friend, they may have added "SV" instead of "Re" to the subject line. When I reply, the subject line now contains "Re: SV:". When they reply, the subject line contains "SV: Re: SV:". And so on...

I can, of course, manually replace "Re: SV:" with "Re:" when replying, but is there a way to get Thunderbird to do this automatically?
creator: SumoBot

title: Total Message Count not showing after restart
content: I am running Win10 22H2 with TB 115.5.0 (64-bit). Total Message Count works fine; I then restart TB and TMC does not show although the TMC option still shows as checked. If I un-check, then re-check TMC, the Total Message Count again shows. Please refer to the attachments for visuals.

title: Filtro rápido
content: Tengo la versión 115.5.0 (32-bit) y el FILTRO RÁPIDO va lentisimo cuando está clickado búsqueda por CUERPO. Y otro problema es que cuando envío un email con CCO y quiero buscar en ese filtro, este destinatario marcado en CCO no aparece, pero si utilizo el filtro general tampoco funciona.

creator: lucbin57

title: Cannot send email
content:
Greetings! This morning, I suddenly cannot send emails. I am using Tbird 120.0 for my Spectrum Road Runner account. No problem receiving emails and no problem getting onto webmail where I can send and receive. And I am getting this error message when I attempt to send:

Sending of the message failed. An error occurred while sending mail: Outgoing server (SMTP) error. The server responded: p-impout005.msg.pkvw.co.charter.net cmsmtp Connection Rejected - see http://www.spamhaus.org/query/ip/76.37.3.140 AUP#Out-1220.

I've checked my account settings and don't see anything untoward and have changed nothing. Admittedly, I am no expert but have done my best to check on FAQs and possible similar sounding issues.

Any thoughts?

Many thanks for any ideas and/or solutions.
creator: memalone

title: Upgrade to macOS Sonoma from Catalina
content:
Help,

I've delayed upgrading from Catalina to Sonoma just in case I lose over 10 years and 1000's of TB mails in nearly a hundred folders - vital to my work.

However, I can no longer upgrade my Photoshop and Lightroom. Dare I bite the bullet or will it just screw me up and lose my mails?

I'm not comfortable going "under the hood" into the directory etc. so dread the replies I might get. So please keep it simple. Or should I just take it in to my local (independent) Apple geek?

Thanks in advance...
creator: brian.shipman

title: Export Entire Inbox from Thunderbird
content:
Hi everyone - is there a way to export ALL emails from a Yahoo Mail inbox? I have tried right clicking on literally every single folder in the account, clicking on "ImportExportTools NG" then "Export All Messages in Folder" and it only exported like a maximum of 30-ish emails, minimum of 1 in each inbox. I also tried the ImportExport add-on and the sizes of the files were not right. I'm wondering if the files in the "ImapMail" folder in C drive contain whole thing?

Thanks so much for anything I can try at this point.
creator: eychen13

title: How do I get messages from a single email account in thunderbird supernova?
content:
Previously I could hit a little arrow on the download messages button that showed a list of my email addresses, and then I'd select one and get the messages for it.

Now there is a button to download all messages.

There is also the same button that appears when you highlight an email address, but clicking it downloads messages from all the email addresses on that server, not just the email address I selected.

How do I get messages for one single email address, regardless if I have several email addresses from the same server? I've tried customizing the toolbar but I don't see anything relevant.
creator: loposys

title: [Gmail] folder vanished
content:
TB115 the [Gmail] folder has vanished. The subfolders it had in it are still there. Using another email client on iPad and Android show everything correctly. TB when clicking on menus shows it when looking at folder lists. However in the folder display on the left pane of the display it is not there. For some reason there are two Draffts follders but that may not be connected with this.

I have seen an article suggesting moving the panacea.dat and global-messages-db.sqlite files from the profile directory to a different directory on the hard drive. However there does not seem to be a panacea.dat file.

Any ideas or suggestions of how to restore things to normal. there are a number of email accounts in my profile, because I am a very longterm user of TB. Backing up the profile does take about 3 hours, so I am very cautious about what I try and careful to have a way back if needed.

Great product and thanks for any help.
creator: lordjohn

title: emails in Inbox and other folders
content:
This is probably quite simple but I can't figure out how (possibly not familiar with the correct terminology)

The problem is incoming emails are getting put into threads whereas I would like them to be all separate (as they always were until recently) When grouped in this way they can't be sorted into the correct sequence by date or correspondent. And that makes it difficult to trace old emails to decide whether to delete or retain them.

What I am seeking is a way to keep all emails in the Inbox separate when they are received (and similarly with sent ones in the "sent" folder) and/or A way to separate out emails which have already grouped into threads

Any help would be appreciated thanks Nick
creator: nickwhitten

content:

title: Emails Duplicate Immediately After Deletion
content: As of 11/21/2023, I have not received any new emails. Whenever I open Thunderbird, my emails duplicate immediately after deletion. Please help.

title: thunder bird update ruined my email
content: The newest Thunderbird upgrade has ruined my email. I cannot send email and Thunderbird no longer recognizes my settings. I want to remove this update and go back to the previous build that I had. If this cannot be fixed I will need to get a new email manager.
creator: mc2cheryl

title: Thundebird keeps listing old folders
content:
1) I was using Thundebird 115.5.0 (64-bit) for reading emails on an Office365 IMAP server (on Mac OS Sonoma 14.1.1).

2) I have reorganized all the folders on the server, deleted some of them, etc. using Outlook on the web.

3) After reorganizing folders and messages, I tried to sync Thundebird, unsuccessfully. Thunderbird kept "seeing" old, deleted folders, that are no longer on the server. The K-9 Android email client had no problem in detecting the new structure: K-9 lists only existing folders and none of those that have been deleted.

4) I uninstalled Thunderbird, removed all the profiles and reinstalled Thunderbird. I get this: - all of the current folders are in grey and italic. They appear to be empty. - When I try and subscribe (after refreshing) the folders, I get a list of old folders, that do not exist any more. I deleted both the .app and the files in the Library, including the profiles.

Is there anyone who knows what's happening with Thunderbird?
creator: lordthistle

title: not able to send emails
content: I am not able to send emails but can receive them. Also I have 2 email addresses being rayjanenes@westnet.com.au and rayandjalb@westnet.com.au
creator: rayjanenes

title: Option to Customize From Address is not always available
content:
I just upgraded to v115.5.0

When I compose an email message, I can select the "Customize From Address..." on the menu for the from address. If I reply to a message that was sent to an existing identity, I have the option to "Customize From Address..." on the menu for the from address. When I reply to a message sent to one of my extended email addresses, the option to "Customize From Address..." is on the menu, but disabled. Prior to version 115.5.0 this worked and I was able to customize the from address when replying to a message sent to an email address that did not match an existing identity. I use extended email addressing, so I need the option to customize the from address -- is there some way to enable this option again?
creator: moseley-mozilla

title: message from Thunderbird when trying to access account "may have too many cached connections, use IMAP Advanced Settings to reduce cached
content:
After clicking the Thunderbird to enter my email the whole system goes through connecte3d to uepat624@gmail.com then up comes a message from Thunderbird indicating "you may have too many cached connections use IMAP Advanced Settings to reduce cached connections" Then things continue on for probably 5 to 10 mins. sending login info, looking up IMAP, checking mail server capabilities, looking for folders, sending login, opening folder box, downloading

Eventually email inbox and messages come up. I can send, receive and send mass mailings but when you read a message and want to go back to the inbox you have to scroll all the little boxes at the top of the screen back to the one that says "inbox".

I need someone to remove the cached connections. Pat Blackburn
creator: uepat624

title: Recover deleted emails from thunderbird
content: I recently deleted emails from my I pad which has also removed them from my pc. I need to recover them please
